name: regild
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to gild a surface (= cover it with a thin layer of gold or a substance that looks like gold) for a second, third, etc. time: He regilds picture frames. A team of 75 painters spent months re-gilding the high ceilings.
to make something very highly respected again : The designs regild their reputation for quality, value, and style. It was an orchestrated strategy to re-gild the company's image.
More examplesFewer examplesThe angel was regilded with real gold leaf. You might come across a mirror that has been re-gilded but retains much of its original first layer of gilding below.
